main event: A large luminous object was sighted while traveling on U.S. Route 60 from Covington, Virginia to White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia on 11 November 1957.
interesting points: The object changed color from orange to gray and seemed to hover before taking off toward the earth's surface., The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes., The object appeared as a 'large fountain pen held horizontally at arm's length' according to one witness., It was reported that there was no unusual noise associated with the object., A witness stated they lost sight of the object when the sun's reflection was no longer visible on it.
location: White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia, USA
witness description: Thomas G. Reynolds, general agent, age 42, with his wife and three children
